skill.name: Page Builder Skill
skill.description: Helper for building landing pages and marketing sites using Tailark components.
skill.summary: Helper for building landing pages and marketing sites using Tailark components.
skill.author: AayushBaniya2006

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown files with component selection guidance. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access capabilities detected.

content.user_title: Build landing pages with Tailark UI components
content.value_statement: Building marketing pages from scratch takes too much time. This skill provides curated recommendations for pre-built Tailark components organized by page type, helping you assemble professional landing pages in minutes.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes page requirements and recommends optimal component combinations
Provides component selection strategy for landing, pricing, about, and contact pages
Lists available Tailark components with file paths and visual descriptions
Offers customization guidance for icons, images, and theme colors
Suggests pre-built component stacks for common page layouts
References component simplicity and recommendation levels
limitations: Does not generate or modify component code directly
Requires ui-handler skill for actual component implementation
Does not customize component internals or create new variants
Does not integrate with design systems beyond Tailark components

use_cases.title: Rapid landing page assembly
use_cases.description: Quickly assemble professional landing pages by selecting recommended Tailark component stacks.

use_cases.title: Marketing page planning
use_cases.description: Plan marketing page structure using pre-defined component combinations for different page types.

use_cases.title: Quick launch pages
use_cases.description: Build launch-ready pages fast with curated, production-ready UI components.

prompt_templates.title: Basic landing page
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a landing page with a hero section, features, social proof, and call to action.

prompt_templates.title: Pricing comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pricing page with comparison tables and FAQ section.

prompt_templates.title: About page
prompt_templates.prompt: Build an about page with team section, company stats, and content narrative.

prompt_templates.title: Custom marketing page
prompt_templates.prompt: Compose a marketing page combining contact section, integrations display, and testimonials.

output_examples.input: Build a landing page with hero, features, and pricing
output: For your landing page, I recommend: HeroSection for the main banner with call to action, Features-12 (accordion style) to showcase how your product works, LogoCloud to display trusted customers, and Pricing or PricingComparator for plan details. Stack them in a semantic <main> tag and customize colors through your global theme.

best_practices: Follow the recommended component stacks for each page type to ensure visual consistency.
Replace placeholder images and icons with real assets before deployment.
Customize components by copying them locally when significant changes are needed.
anti_patterns: Do not import components without reviewing their complexity and dependencies.
Avoid mixing too many different component styles on a single page.
Do not skip the component selection strategy - it ensures cohesive page design.

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for composing marketing pages.

faq.question: Can I customize the components?
faq.answer: Yes, you can copy components locally and modify text, images, colors, and layouts.

faq.question: Does this skill write code?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides guidance. Use ui-handler to actually implement the components.

faq.question: Are the components responsive?
faq.answer: Yes, all Tailark components are built with Tailwind CSS and are fully responsive.

faq.question: What dependencies are required?
faq.answer: Components use lucide-react icons, next/image, and some require motion/react or recharts.

faq.question: How is this different from ui-handler?
faq.answer: ui-handler installs components, page-builder helps you select and compose them effectively.
